Vindictus.[COMMUNITY] DevTalk Afterwords:
o. This is DEV Allanon, the Director of Vindictus. 

First, I'd like to apologize for the late Dev Talk. 
I've promised earlier that it'll be revealed by the end of the month.  

In fact, it was originally planned to be disclosed on the 23rd.

But due to unexpected internal reasons, we had to delay the release by a week. 
If further explanation is needed like this time, I will endeavor to expand our communication channels as much as possible. 
 
In response to feedback from many of our players who felt burdened by the Expertise Proficiency, I've decided to double the Proficiency and Crafting Speed until the Max Level Update. 
 
Additionally, to build anticipation for the new female character, I dropped a hint during the Dev Talk. 
Another clue: she is related to a specific character. 
 
Although it was unintentional, I inadvertently spoiled a recently updated storyline.
I will take greater care to prevent such situations from occurring in the future. 

[b]Here are some of the inquiries we've received in a Q&A format. [/b]

[b]Q: [/b]Would LV.120 equipment only be craftable through Expertise? 
[quote]A: Yes, LV.120 equipment is planned to be exclusively crafted through Expertise.  
This includes weapons, armor, totems, and accessories.  
To avoid any confusion, there will be no changes in the equipment available for crafting through each Expertise. [/quote]

[b]Q:[/b] Is maximizing Expertise Proficiency mandatory? 
[quote]A: No, it is not mandatory to have maximum Expertise Proficiency to obtain LV.120 equipment.  
Alternatively, you can request assistance from other players with the required Expertise level to craft the equipment for you.  

You may also use binded materials and items when requesting the craft from others. [/quote]

[b]Q: [/b]When crafting LV.120 equipment, will Power Infusion and Quality be transferred? 
[quote]A: We do not plan to transfer Power Infusion and Quality when crafting LV.120 equipment.  
However, enchants will be transferred when using the Extraction Rune during the crafting process. [/quote]

[b]Q:[/b] Will LV.120 Armor be updated in the order of [Head – Chest – Leg – Hand – Foot]? 
[quote] A: The plan for updating LV120 equipment is as follows: 
[table]			[tr]			[td]			
Weapon (Beginner) 
			[/td]			[td]			
Head (Beginner~Legend) 
			[/td]			[td]			
Totem 
			[/td]		[/tr]		[tr]			[td]			
Weapon (Fine) 
			[/td]			[td]			
Leg (Beginner~Legend) 
			[/td]			[td]			
Earring 
			[/td]		[/tr]		[tr]			[td]			
Weapon (Superior) 
			[/td]			[td]			
Chest (Beginner~Legend) 
			[/td]			[td]			
Belt 
			[/td]		[/tr]		[tr]			[td]			
Weapon (Rare) 
			[/td]			[td]			
Hand (Beginner~Legend) 
			[/td]			[td]			
Ring1 
			[/td]		[/tr]		[tr]			[td]			
Weapon (Legend) 
			[/td]			[td]			
Foot (Beginner~Legend) 
			[/td]			[td]			
Ring2 
			[/td]		[/tr]	[/table]
[/quote]
[b]Q: [/b]Will LV.120 equipment require no enhancement? Does this mean Superior Enhancement Elixir, Enhancement Rune, and Premium Enhancement Rune will no longer be needed? 
[quote]A: Even after reaching LV120, our plan is to retain the necessity of these items when upgrading the item tier. [/quote]

[b]Q: [/b]Will there be a success rate for the LV.120 equipment upgrade? 
[quote]A: We intend to remove any possibility aspects from the upgrade process.  
Players will only need the required materials for the upgrade.We'll monitor closely to determine if further explanation is necessary. [/quote

Vindictus.Message from the Dev Team Regarding a Ne:
o. This is DEV Allanon, the Director of Vindictus.

I would like to deliver the official statement from the dev team to our players following the announcement that Nexon's newly developed game using the Vindictus IP, "Vindictus: Defying Fate," will be entering a pre-alpha test on Steam.

"Vindictus: Defying Fate" is a brand-new game that is being developed.

Due to its use of the Vindictus IP, the game will contain familiar characters, NPCs, region names, monsters, and certain outfits.

However, "Vindictus: Defying Fate" is being developed as a single-player focused game, aiming to be released on console and PC platforms, which moves it in a very different direction from the original Vindictus.

Since their gameplay differs this will have no impact on the service of Vindictus during the development of "Vindictus: Defying Fate," both now and in the future when it is released.

Vindictus is still planning to provide content for both short and long-term play, starting with our upcoming progression structure improvements in April and soon followed by our max level expansion this May.

We will continue to actively deliver our updates and our talks with you, like we have been doing, and as ever we'll do our best to include what you players want to see.

We anticipate that "Vindictus: Defying Fate" will be an opportunity to spread the IP even further out while we continue to maintain Vindictus as the original, and we will work hard to maintain the charm of the original Vindictus that we have built alongside our players.

We hope to get your continued support for our franchise.

I would like to thank all of our Vindictus players, and I wish nothing but happiness and health for you all.

Thank you!
